Key Match Events: The Twins' bullpen was running on fumes after being over-extended in Thursday's 13-inning loss to the Miami Marlins
Baltimore erupted for five runs after Lopez left the game
Post-Match Reflections: The loss dropped the Twins to 82-78, completing their historic second-half collapse
Minnesota went 12-25 over its last 37 games, going from 17 games over.500 and two games out of first place in mid-August to out of a playoff spot by late September
Miscellaneous Highlights: Baltimore secured the No. 4 seed with Friday's victory
The Orioles will have home-field advantage during next week's AL Wild Card Round
Others: The Twins allowed two division rivals to pass them in the standings and take their postseason spot
Detroit surged right past them thanks to one of the most impressive hot streaks in recent memory
Kansas City somehow won enough to survive two separate seven-game losing streaks down the stretch
